result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip E Chism

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Cases called at 10:00 AM: 22CF1116, 21CT330, 22CF49, 22CF441. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Phillip E Chism appeared by telephone.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by telephone for Phillip E Chism.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was his right to personal appearance.
22CF1116: Defendant waives reading of Complaint and Time Limits for Preliminary Hearing.  $1,000 Signature Bond Set. Defendant ordered to sign the bond at the Clerk of Courts Office. 
Eau Claire JA to schedule Preliminary Hearing in intake with 21CT330, 22CF49, 22CF441 to ride along.
STC in all cases: 12/22/22 at 9:45 AM.

Conditions: 
No contact with co-defendants Sherise Howard and Daniel Phillips.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
